snippet: Shrinking exports and America’s growing reliance on hydraulic fracturing and renewable energy have left coal producers in deep trouble.
abstract: Dwindling demand for coal creates acute economic hardship in West Virginia as mines shut down, leaving workers without job prospects and towns without sources of revenue; traditional structure of coal industry has become unsustainable as power plants switch to natural gas and China and developing countries move to limit pollution.
lead_paragraph: Shrinking exports and America’s growing reliance on hydraulic fracturing and renewable energy have left coal producers in deep trouble.

headline.main: Coal Miners Struggle to Survive in an Industry Battered by Layoffs and Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: Miners Bracing for a Future of Ever-Dwindling Demand for Coal
